name: PRISM
headline: 3 Sites In Uganda from 2011â€“2016
points: The Program for Resistance, Immunology, Surveillance and Modeling of Malaria in Uganda (PRISM) Study is a part of International Centers of Excellence for Malaria Research Program
Longitudinal cohort & entomological surveillance study designs
1,402 Participants from 331 Households with over 44,000 clinic observations

name: India ICEMR
headline: 3 sites across India from 2013-2015
points: Part of the International Centers of Excellence for Malaria Research (ICEMR) Program
Cross-sectional and longitudinal cohort study designs
3664 participants from 1394 households with over 4000 observations

name: GEMS
headline: Coming Soon!
points: The Global Enteric Multicenter Study (GEMS) investigated the cause, the incidence and the impact of moderate-to-severe diarrhea (MSD).
Case-Control study with a 60-day follow-up visit
22,568 Participants from The Gambia, Mali, Kenya, Mozambique, Pakistan, India and Bangladesh

name: MAL-ED
headline: MAL-ED PhaseI DCC
points: Etiology, Risk Factors and Interactions of Enteric Infections and Malnutrition and the Consequences for Child Health and Development Study
Longitudinal birth cohort of the first 2 years of life
200 Participants from each of 8 sites (in Bangladesh, Brazil, India, Nepal, Pakistan, Peru, South Africa, Tanzania)

name: Other ICEMR Studies
headline: Coming Soon!
points: A part of International Centers of Excellence for Malaria Research Program
